occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 225 ):  yoginītantre : nirvīryañca piturmantraṃ tathā mātāmahasya ca
(line 227 ):  yattu : sādhvī caiva sadācārā gurubhaktā jitendriyā |
(line 228 ): sarvamantrārthatattvajñā suśīlā pūjate ratā | guruyogyā bhavet sā
word_by_word: in-Yogini-Tantra and-powerless father's-mantra thus of-maternal-grandfather and
but-that-which virtuous-woman and-indeed of-good-conduct devoted-to-guru with-controlled-senses
knower-of-all-mantra-meanings-and-principles of-good-character worships engaged-in worthy-of-guru should-be she
occurrences.natural_translation: In the Vaishampayana Samhita addressed to Shaunaka towards in the words of Vyasa || [verse-72] || In the Yogini Tantra it is stated powerless the mantra of one's father thus of the maternal grandfather and That which is obtained in a dream or given by a woman becomes pure through ritual consecration || [verse-73] || But she who is virtuous of good conduct, devoted to the guru, with controlled senses who knows the meaning and essence of all mantras-and-principles of good character, engaged in worship she should be considered worthy of the guru
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 238 ): dīkṣāyāṃ naiva dūṣaṇam | na kuryāddaśame māsi kṛtvā ca
(line 240 ):  svapnalabdhamantre yadi sadguruṃ prāpnoti tadā tata eva
(line 242 ): prāṇapratiṣṭhāṃ vidhāya vaṭapatre kuṃkumena likhitaṃ mantraṃ
occurrences.natural_translation: [dīkṣāyāṃ] [naiva] [dūṣaṇam] not [kuryāddaśame] [māsi] [kṛtvā] and [nārakī] [bhave] || (verse 78) || a mantra obtained in a dream if [sadguruṃ] [prāpnoti] then [tata] indeed [tanmantraṃ] [gṛhṇīyāt] [nacet] [jalapūrṇakalase] of-guru [prāṇapratiṣṭhāṃ] [vidhāya] [vaṭapatre] [kuṃkumena] [likhitaṃ] mantra
occurrences.interpretation: Refers to the ritual installation of dream-received energies or mantras into a consecrated vessel (kalaśa) for worship.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 242 ): prāṇapratiṣṭhāṃ vidhāya vaṭapatre kuṃkumena likhitaṃ mantraṃ
(line 244 ):  tathā hi : svapnalabdhe ca kalase guroḥ prāṇāna niveśayet |
(line 245 ): vaṭapatre kuṃkumena likhitvā grahaṇe śubham | tataḥ
(line 246 ): siddhimavāpnoti cānyathā viphalaṃ bhavet | idandu sadgurorābhāve
word_by_word: thus for in-the-dream-obtained and in-vessel of-guru life-forces should-install
occurrences.natural_translation: [prāṇapratiṣṭhāṃ] [vidhāya] [vaṭapatre] [kuṃkumena] [likhitaṃ] mantra [tatkalase] [prakṣipya] [uttolya] mantra [gṛhṇīyādityarthaḥ] || (verse 79) || thus for regarding that which is obtained in a dream and in-vessel of-guru one should install the life-forces [vaṭapatre] [kuṃkumena] [likhitvā] [grahaṇe] [śubham] [tataḥ] [siddhimavāpnoti] [cānyathā] [viphalaṃ] should-be [idandu] [sadgurorābhāve]
occurrences.interpretation: Refers to the ritual installation of dream-received energies or mantras into a consecrated vessel (kalaśa) for worship.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 309 ):  tathā ca : dhanimantraṃ na gṛhṇīyādakulañca tathaiva ca |
(line 311 ): tannirūpyate | svapnalabdhe striyā datte māmāmantre ca tryakṣare |
(line 312 ): kālī - tārāmaṇau mantrī tathā chinnamanāvapi | vaidikeṣu ca
occurrences.natural_translation: thus and [dhanimantraṃ] not [gṛhṇīyādakulañca] [tathaiva] and [ityādau] thus [darśanāttattaccakravicārasyāvasśyakatvāt] [prathamaṃ] [tannirūpyate] regarding that which is obtained in a dream by-a-woman gives [māmāmantre] and [tryakṣare] [kālī] [tārāmaṇau] [mantrī] thus [chinnamanāvapi] [vaidikeṣu] and [sarveṣu] [siddhādīnnaiva] one should purify || (verse 2) ||
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: the mantra of one's father thus of the maternal grandfather and that-which-is-dream-obtained by-a-woman given through-consecration-indeed becomes purified ||  but-that-which
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 146 ): svapnalabdhe ca kalaśe guroḥ prāṇaṃ niveśayet |
occurrences.natural_translation: In the Yogini Tantra it is stated  regarding that which is obtained in a dream and in the ritual vessel of-guru [prāṇaṃ] should-install [vaṭapatre] [kuṃkumena] [likhitvā] [grahaṇaṃ] [śubham] || [tataḥ] [siddhimavāpnoti] [anyathā] [viphalaṃ] should-be
occurrences.interpretation: Refers to the ritual installation of dream-received energies or mantras into a consecrated vessel (kalaśa) for worship.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 200 ): tāraḥ praṇavaḥ | prāsādaḥ hoṃ | sapiṇḍākṣaraḥ kūṭamaṃtra iti |
(line 202 ): p. 5) svapnalabdhe striyā datte mālāmantre ca tryakṣare ||
occurrences.natural_translation: [tāraḥ] [praṇavaḥ] [prāsādaḥ] [hoṃ] [sapiṇḍākṣaraḥ] [kūṭamaṃtra] thus  [p] (verse 5) regarding that which is obtained in a dream by-a-woman gives [mālāmantre] and [tryakṣare] || [vaidikeṣu] and [sarveṣu] [siddhādīnnaiva] one should purify
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 3207 ): śivāpadāmbhoja yugārcakānāṃ bhogaśca mokṣaśca karastha eva ||
(line 3208 ): yo'nyebhyo darśanebhyaśca bhuktiṃ muktiṃ ca kāṃkṣati ||
(line 3210 ): jāyeta pārvati ! || tathānya darśanebhyaśca bhuktiṃ muktiṃ ca kāṃkṣati ||
occurrences.natural_translation: [śivāpadāmbhoja] [yugārcakānāṃ] [bhogaśca] [mokṣaśca] [karastha] indeed || [yo] [nyebhyo] [darśanebhyaśca] [bhuktiṃ] [muktiṃ] and [kāṃkṣati] || destroyer-of-dream-obtained [dhanavānsabhavedyadi] || [śuktorajatavibhrāntiryathā] [jāyeta] [pārvati] || [tathānya] [darśanebhyaśca] [bhuktiṃ] [muktiṃ] and [kāṃkṣati] ||
occurrences.interpretation: Indicates material prosperity or sovereignty obtained through prophetic dreams or dream-divination.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 2175 ): siddhādiśodhanaṃ devī na vai teṣāṃ tu vidyate |
occurrences.natural_translation: [aryarisvāmahāmantraprāptena] [suniścitam] || (verse 16) (verse 126) || [etaduktaṃ] [maheśāni] [tyaktvā] [nyamatamuttamam] regarding that which is obtained in a dream by-a-woman gives [mālamantre] [tribījake] || (verse 16) (verse 127) || [siddhādiśodhanaṃ] goddess not [vai] [teṣāṃ] but [vidyate] [śrīvidyāpūjanasthāne] [cakrarāje] [maheśvari] || (verse 16) (verse 128) ||
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 55 ): kurve sarvāgamānāṃ paraśiva vacasāṃ saṃgrahaṃ nīlakaṇṭhaḥ
(line 58 ): liṅgāṅgī manujo bhavedyadi punaḥ yadaivāṅga bhāk
occurrences.natural_translation: [bhūyasyai] [pritaye] [haṃ] [jagatisumanasāṃ] [satkriyāsāramenam] [kurve] [sarvāgamānāṃ] [paraśiva] [vacasāṃ] [saṃgrahaṃ] [nīlakaṇṭhaḥ] [smāraṃ] [smāraṃ] [smārermanumanukalaya] dream-obtained || (verse 7) ||  [liṅgāṅgī] [manujo] [bhavedyadi] [punaḥ] [yadaivāṅga] [bhāk]

occurrences.author: Unknown

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 1836 ): svapnalabdhe ca kalaśe guroḥ prāṇān niveśayet |
occurrences.natural_translation: [saṃskāraśca] [tatraiva]  regarding that which is obtained in a dream and in the ritual vessel of-guru [prāṇān] should-install [vaṭapatre] [kuṅkumena] [likhitvā] [grahaṇaṃ] [kṛtam] || (verse 1) (verse 413) ||
occurrences.interpretation: Refers to the ritual installation of dream-received energies or mantras into a consecrated vessel (kalaśa) for worship.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [ekākṣare] thus [kūṭe] [mālāmantre] [tribījake] regarding that which is obtained in a dream by-a-woman gives [siddhādīnnaiva] one should purify || (verse 1) (verse 543) ||  [mālāmantralakṣaṇaṃ] and [nārāyaṇī] in-tantra
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 2860 ): svapnalabdhā ca yā vidyā tatra nāsti vicāraṇā || 1-549 ||
occurrences.natural_translation: by-a-woman initiation [śubhā] [proktā] [mātuścāṣṭaguṇādhikā] dream-obtained and [yā] knowledge there [nāsti] [vicāraṇā] || (verse 1) (verse 549) ||  [yoginī] in-tantra
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 1142 ): svapne tu niyamo nāsti dīkṣāsu guruśiṣyayoḥ |
occurrences.natural_translation: in-dream but [niyamo] [nāsti] [dīkṣāsu] [guruśiṣyayoḥ] regarding that which is obtained in a dream by-a-woman gives through-consecration-indeed becomes purified || (verse 2) (verse 107) ||  virtuous-woman of good conduct, devoted to the guru, with controlled senses
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 834 ): striyo dīkṣā śubhā proktā mātuścāṣṭaguṇā smṛtā |
(line 835 ): svapnalabdhā ca yā dīkṣā tatra nāsti vicāraṇā ||
(line 837 ):  striya iti padaṃ na sarvastrīparam | vidhavāyā na gurutvam | taduktaṃ
occurrences.natural_translation: [striyo] initiation [śubhā] [proktā] [mātuścāṣṭaguṇā] [smṛtā] dream-obtained and [yā] initiation there [nāsti] [vicāraṇā] ||  [striya] thus [padaṃ] not [sarvastrīparam] [vidhavāyā] not [gurutvam] [taduktaṃ]
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [yo] [nyebhyo] [darśanebhyaśca] [bhuktiṃ] [muktiñca] [kāṃkṣati] dream-obtained-wealth [dhanavān] what [bhavennaraḥ] ||  [śuktau] [rajatavibhrāntiryathā] [jāyeta] [pārvati]
occurrences.interpretation: Indicates material prosperity or sovereignty obtained through prophetic dreams or dream-divination.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [śrīdevyuvāca]  regarding that which is obtained in a dream [mahādevi] [ṛṣicchandādikaṃ] how [ṛṣicchandādikaṃ] [yanna] in-dream [proktaṃ] [maheśvara] || (verse 3) (verse 108) ||
occurrences.interpretation: General reference to elements (mantras, teachings, powers) obtained through dream revelation in tantric practice.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 1566 ): svapnalabdhe sriyā datte hyantaraṃ tu kiyadbhavet |
occurrences.natural_translation: [taduttaraṃ] [mahādevi] [gajāntakasahasrakam] || (verse 3) (verse 121) ||  regarding that which is obtained in a dream [sriyā] gives [hyantaraṃ] but [kiyadbhavet] [saṃskāre] [sāmyatā] [devi] [ghaṭasaṃskāramātrake] || (verse 3) (verse 122) ||
occurrences.interpretation: General reference to elements (mantras, teachings, powers) obtained through dream revelation in tantric practice.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 1602 ): pūrvaṃ proktaṃ tvayā deva svapnalabdhādayaḥ prabho || 3-131 ||
occurrences.natural_translation: [śrīdevyuvāca]  [pūrvaṃ] [proktaṃ] [tvayā] god dream-obtained [prabho] || (verse 3) (verse 131) ||  dream-obtained by-a-woman [dattā] [mālāmaṃtrādikāḥ] [priya]
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 1602 ): pūrvaṃ proktaṃ tvayā deva svapnalabdhādayaḥ prabho || 3-131 ||
occurrences.natural_translation: [pūrvaṃ] [proktaṃ] [tvayā] god dream-obtained [prabho] || (verse 3) (verse 131) ||  dream-obtained by-a-woman [dattā] [mālāmaṃtrādikāḥ] [priya] [siddhamaṃtrā] thus [proktāstvanyathā] [pratipāditam] || (verse 3) (verse 132) ||
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 1661 ): japo homo brāhmaṇānāṃ bhojanaṃ tritayaṃ matam |
occurrences.natural_translation: [paṃcāṅgā] but [puraścaryā] [gauḍamārge] [prakīrttitā] regarding that which is obtained in a dream [maheśāni] [aṅge] [puraskriyā] [matā] || (verse 3) (verse 149) ||  [japo] [homo] [brāhmaṇānāṃ] [bhojanaṃ] [tritayaṃ] [matam]
occurrences.interpretation: General reference to elements (mantras, teachings, powers) obtained through dream revelation in tantric practice.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 1661 ): japo homo brāhmaṇānāṃ bhojanaṃ tritayaṃ matam |
occurrences.natural_translation: [japo] [homo] [brāhmaṇānāṃ] [bhojanaṃ] [tritayaṃ] [matam] regarding that which is obtained in a dream [puraścaryā] [doṣadvayanivāraṇam] || (verse 3) (verse 150) ||  [jātasūtakamādau] [syāttadante] [mṛtasūtakam]
occurrences.interpretation: General reference to elements (mantras, teachings, powers) obtained through dream revelation in tantric practice.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 1701 ): caitanyatrayahīno yaḥ sa maṃtraḥ siddhido na hi || 3-159 ||
(line 1703 ): svapnalabdho dhanī cetsyāttadā kiṃ vā vidhīyatām |
occurrences.natural_translation: [caitanyatrayahīno] [yaḥ] he [maṃtraḥ] [siddhido] not for || (verse 3) (verse 159) ||  dream-obtained [dhanī] [cetsyāttadā] what or [vidhīyatām] [mantrānusārato] [devi] [puraścaryāṃ] [samācaret] || (verse 3) (verse 160) ||
occurrences.interpretation: References supernatural powers or spiritual accomplishments gained through dream-initiation or dream-yoga practices.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [strīlabdhe] [devadeveśi] [śrīmaddevīparaṃparā] regarding that which is obtained in a dream [mahādevi] [dakṣamūrttiparaṃparā] || (verse 3) (verse 180) ||  [pūjayeddakṣiṇāmūrttiṃ] [gurutvena] [maheśvari]
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 4202 ):  pañcame saṃśayātmā syāt ṣaṣṭhaḥ sarvavināśakaḥ || iti
(line 4204 ):  piṇḍe tāre svapnalabdhe ṣaḍarṇe prāsādārkatraipure nārasiṃhe |
(line 4205 ):  mālā māyāmātṛvārāha kāmāstre no doṣaḥ stryāptavedeṣu ratne ||
occurrences.natural_translation: [pañcame] [saṃśayātmā] would-be [ṣaṣṭhaḥ] [sarvavināśakaḥ] || thus here [sarvatra] [siddhādiśodhanāpavādo] [granthāntaroktaḥ] [piṇḍe] [tāre] regarding that which is obtained in a dream [ṣaḍarṇe] [prāsādārkatraipure] [nārasiṃhe] [mālā] [māyāmātṛvārāha] [kāmāstre] [no] [doṣaḥ] [stryāptavedeṣu] [ratne] || thus
occurrences.interpretation: General reference to elements (mantras, teachings, powers) obtained through dream revelation in tantric practice.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [vaiśampāyanasaṃhitāyām]  that-which-is-dream-obtained by-a-woman given through-consecration-indeed becomes purified  [saṃskāraśca] [tatraiva]
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 593 ): svapnalabdhe ca kalaśe guroḥ prāṇān niveśayet |
occurrences.natural_translation: [saṃskāraśca] [tatraiva]  regarding that which is obtained in a dream and in the ritual vessel of-guru [prāṇān] should-install [vaṭapatre] [kuṅkumena] [likhitvā] [grahaṇaṃ] [śubham] ||
occurrences.interpretation: Refers to the ritual installation of dream-received energies or mantras into a consecrated vessel (kalaśa) for worship.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 597 ): candrapīṭhe - svapnalabdhaḥ striyā datto dattaḥ kenāpyasādhitaḥ |
(line 598 ): phaladā api te mantrā gṛhītavyāstu sadguroḥ ||
occurrences.natural_translation: [tataḥ] [siddhimavāpnoti] [viphalaṃ] [tvanyathā] should-be [candrapīṭhe] dream-obtained by-a-woman [datto] [dattaḥ] [kenāpyasādhitaḥ] [phaladā] also they/to-you [mantrā] [gṛhītavyāstu] [sadguroḥ] ||
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [ūrddhvāmnāye] [yo] [nyebhyodarśanebhyaśca] [bhuktiṃ] [muktiñca] [kāṅkṣati] dream-obtained indeed with wealth [dhanavān] he [bhaved] if ||  [p] (verse 3)
occurrences.interpretation: Indicates material prosperity or sovereignty obtained through prophetic dreams or dream-divination.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [upadeśaḥ] [kulastrīṇāṃ] [dīkṣābhedopadeśakau] ||  [upāsanāvidhiḥ] dream-obtained [maṃtrasya] [nirṇayaḥ] [manorgurośca] [devasyatyāgodaśa] [prakāśake] ||
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [ekākṣare] thus [kūṭe] [mālāmaṃtre] [tribījake] ||  regarding that which is obtained in a dream [striyādatte] [siddhādīnnaiva] one should purify [viṃśatparṇādhikāmaṃtrā] [mālāmaṃtrāḥ] [prakīrtitāḥ] ||
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [devatāśāpamāpnoti] [kṛtaṃ] and [vikṛtaṃ] should-be then dream-obtained [maṃtropāsanama] [kramamāha] ||  [svapnamaṃtrā] [mahādevi] [tridhā] [vai] [pariniṣṭitā]
occurrences.interpretation: General reference to elements (mantras, teachings, powers) obtained through dream revelation in tantric practice.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 6005 ): yatra noktaṃ mahādeva tatra tat tatkathaṃ bhavet ||
occurrences.natural_translation: [yatra] [noktaṃ] [mahādeva] there that [tatkathaṃ] should-be ||  of that which is obtained in a dream [maṃtrasya] [ṛṣiḥ] [śiva] [itīritaḥ] [gāyatrī] [chaṃdaścidrūpā] deity [parikīrtitā] ||
occurrences.interpretation: General reference to elements (mantras, teachings, powers) obtained through dream revelation in tantric practice.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [mūlamaṃtrā] [ṣaḍāvṛttyā] [ṣaḍaṃganyā] [samācaret] regarding that which is obtained in a dream [mahādevī] [dakṣamūrtiḥ] [paraṃparā] ||  [pūjayed] [dakṣiṇāmūrtiṃ] [gurutvena] [maheśvarī]
occurrences.interpretation: General reference to elements (mantras, teachings, powers) obtained through dream revelation in tantric practice.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [taduttaraṃ] [mahādevī] [gajāṃtaka] [sahasrakaṃ] regarding that which is obtained in a dream [maheśāni] [tryaṃgātpuratkriyāmatā] ||  [japahomau] [brāhmaṇānāṃ] [bhojanaṃ] [tritayaṃ] [mataṃ]
occurrences.interpretation: General reference to elements (mantras, teachings, powers) obtained through dream revelation in tantric practice.

occurrences.author: Unknown
occurrences.natural_translation: [layotkīlayaniṣkīlayaniṣkīlayahrīṃsvāhā] [sādhāraṇenajalenanimajjayāvachvāsā] [taṃpratyakṣaraṃhrīṃmūlaṃhrīṃityacchāviṃśatijapātśāpavimocanaṃ] (verse 1) [athasaptaśatomālā] dream-obtained [japahomayorevavidhānāt] [ataḥsaṃ] [pradāyaparaṃparayāmūlamaṃtrasaṃpūṭīkṛtajapenaivatattatkāmanāsiddhiḥatevakānyaprayo] [gamātrakathanaṃkṛtaṃtaṃtrakāraiḥprayogānāha] [pratiślokamādyaṃtayoḥpraṇavaṃjapenmaṃtrasiddhiḥ]
occurrences.interpretation: References supernatural powers or spiritual accomplishments gained through dream-initiation or dream-yoga practices.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 7653 ): pitrormantraṃ [mātāmahāt pituścaiva mantraṃ na gṛhṇīyānnaraḥ] na
(line 7657 ): svapnalabdhe [-mantrasiddhyai] ca kalaśe guroḥ prāṇaṃ niveśayet |
occurrences.natural_translation: [pitrormantraṃ] [mātāmahāt] [pituścaiva] mantra not [gṛhṇīyānnaraḥ] not [gṛhṇīyāttathā] of the maternal grandfather and dream-obtained [strīdattaṃ] through-consecration-indeed becomes purified || (verse 180) ||  regarding that which is obtained in a dream [mantrasiddhyai] and in the ritual vessel of-guru [prāṇaṃ] should-install
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Unknown
sanskrit_lines: (line 7657 ): svapnalabdhe [-mantrasiddhyai] ca kalaśe guroḥ prāṇaṃ niveśayet |
occurrences.natural_translation: dream-obtained [strīdattaṃ] through-consecration-indeed becomes purified || (verse 180) ||  regarding that which is obtained in a dream [mantrasiddhyai] and in the ritual vessel of-guru [prāṇaṃ] should-install [vaṭapatre] [kuṅkumena] [likhitvā] [grahaṇaṃ] thus [tataḥ] [śuddhimavāpnoti] [anyathā] [viphalaṃ] should-be || (verse 181) ||
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.

occurrences.author: Purnananda
sanskrit_lines: (line 3011 ): svapnalabdhe striyā datte siddhādīn na vicārayet || 120 ||
occurrences.natural_translation: [ekākṣare] thus [kūṭe] [mālāmantre] [tribījeke] regarding that which is obtained in a dream by-a-woman gives [siddhādīn] not [vicārayet] || (verse 120) ||  [vaiṣṇaveṣu] and [tantreṣu] [kecidicchanti] [tāntrikāḥ] || (verse 121) ||
occurrences.interpretation: This refers to spiritual knowledge or mantras received in dreams through the feminine principle or from a female guru, requiring ritual purification for activation.
